title: Coconut Rice 🍚 || Lunch || Diwali
content:
Lunch Recipe: South Indian Dish : Coconut Rice 🍚 

Servings : 3 Duration: 10 mins An authentic and traditional South Indian main dish is coconut rice. It is flavored with fresh grated coconut, spices, nuts and ends with lemon juice. This dish is simple & easy to make at home. Why I chose it on festival because it's easy, tasty and quick to prepare. When your home is filled with full of relatives and friends / with close family members, you can easily prepare two or three different rice recipes on festival at home. Pre-preparation is just to cook white rice 🍚 that's it all you need to make it delicious with spices and veggies etc., How to cook white rice?  I explained in detail in palak Mutter Pulao recipe which is in below link Some of the rice recipes I prepared with cooked rice: Prasadam Pulihora/ Temple Style Pulihora/ Tamarind Rice Vangi Bath / Brinjal 🍆 Fried Rice || Karnataka recipe || Navratri Spl Daddojanam / Curd/ yogurt Rice || Temple prasadam || Navratri Palak Mutter Pulao / Spinach Peas Pulao 👌 All these are easy and handy ingredients at home Nutrition facts of Coconut: Vitamin : C Minerals : Iron & Calcium Today I prepared authentic South Indian rice recipe that is coconut rice 🍚 Let's start with ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients: Cooked Rice - 250 gms - 1 bowl Fresh grated coconut - 1 bowl Green chillies - 8 to 10 Cashew nuts - 15 Ground nuts - 1/2 cup - roasted Lemon Juice - 2 tb sp Salt - 1 tb sp Coriander leaves - chopped - 1/2 cup For Tempering: Mustard seeds/ Avvalu - 1 tea spoon Cumin seeds/ Jeera - 1 tea spoon Urad dal/ Minapappu - 1/2 tb sp Bengal gram/ Senagapappu - 1/2 tb sp Curry leaves - 4 to 5 Oil - 2 tb sp Procedure:
  • Heat skillet pan over medium heat
  • Add oil, tempering
  • Saute and add sliced green chillies
  • Saute and add cashew nuts
  • Add roasted peanuts & Saute
  • Fry till color changes to golden brown
  • Turn off Cooktop / Burner
  • Add cooked rice , fresh grated coconut, salt, lemon juice & chopped coriander leaves
  • Mix well
  • Serve it at lunch/ dinner
  • Enjoy your day & Happy cooking 😀
